title: Pulmonary Inpatient Advanced Practice Provider Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions:
December 2021, I applied online to this position. 1 week later, I was contacted via email to setup an interview.

I interviewed January 2022 at Piedmont Atlanta. I was given a 3-hour agenda for the day, where I was to speak to 7 different people over those 3 hours. I met with various APPs and MDs (one person was unavailable). 

The interviews were done either at a nurses station, the APPs office (which is open to the unit), Starbucks, or downstairs in the hospital's sitting area. The interviews were very repetitive; every person asked the same questions. It was hard to get in a groove because I was asked to move to various locations all day.

After the interview, I was told I'd hear back within 1 week. It has been months, and I still haven't heard back. However, the position I applied for is no longer listed.
Interview Questions:
Why did you choose pulmonary?
Can you manage stress?
Where do you live?
What are your hobbies?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions:
I applied for the position through portal calling for nurses to respond to the COVID-19 crisis. I spoke to a friendly and professional HR recruiter. My concerns with the organization started when she discussed the hourly rate for PRN nurses. It was lower than I had earned in previous full-time positions and was far below what other companies pay PRN nurses and just a little over half what others were paying for crisis response. Nevertheless, I decided to move forward with the formal interview.

A few days later I spoke to members of the management team via phone. They were friendly and professional. However, they did not seem to be looking for crisis nurses in particular and asked the standard interview questions you might expect in any nursing interview. 

My biggest problem was when I asked how their operations had been affected by the coronavirus situation and what kind of plans they had in place. I wasn't expecting anything super detailed, yet they were unable to provide any meaningful response. To summarize, they said operations had not really been affected and that the virus wasn't really bad here yet, something that is patently false and speaks to a lack of foresight and awareness of management. Instead, they emphasized the value of customer service...not a bad thing in and of itself, but in the context of my question seemed inappropriate. 

Given my experience with the interview, I accepted another offer shortly after finishing the call. The next day, HR contacted me stating they were moving on with other candidates.
Interview Questions: Why Piedmont?

Only after I requested a call, did she speak with me.   Hiring manager took no responsibility for her complete lack of professionalism, disrespect and unethical behavior. title: IS Remote Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Smyrna, GA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Phone screen with Recruiter
Face to face with Team lead and supervisor 
Ask questions about your background 
If selected, you will receive an Offer 
The process was smooth 
There was an urgent need 
To the process was quick
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience etc

title: Med Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: The Human Resource lady for my application was extremely helpful over the phone interview. Then I was scheduled for a onsite interview. I had to wait for another vacancy and was hired after one month.
Interview Questions: Basically job-related questions.

title: Nurse Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was called by the recruiter less than 24 hours after I put in my application. She asked a few basic and behavioral questions and said she would call me back in a few weeks. She called me after 3 weeks and set up an interview with the cardiovascular progressive care managers, which happened a few days later. The managers I met were very nice and made me comfortable. They asked a couple clinical questions and then several behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had a miscommunication with a team member

title: Senior Project Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online - received a call a few weeks later.  Had a general convo with HR regarding my background, pay requirements and skill sets.  I was then scheduled to speak to the hiring manager a few weeks later. The phone interview went well and was comfortable, I was asked general questions about my previous job and current skill set. She then scheduled for me to come in for a in person interview to meet with her, her team and her manager.  Since I was living in another state and planned to relocate to my new state a few days later. I rearranged my move date to accommodate my interview, which was very inconsiderate especially since I had to follow up several weeks also via phone and email to find out from HR months later that I was not selected out of the 2 positions that were open. Very unprofessional.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time you had to deal with a difficult provider?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is ~2hrs. You interview with the Director, PM and fellow CRCs. Each interviewer had their own style and questions. I'd look up STAR interview to be prepared.
Interview Questions: What's a typical day for you as a CRC

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very easy not a lot of hard questions! Just show them your personality. You won’t have any problem getting a job here! They don’t ask a lot of skill based questions.
Interview Questions: Why did you like that area of nursing

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Very Long and Complex. Took Four Months of Continuous Interviews and Hiring Demands to finally get hired. Expected to be very prepared with extensive background information available and a Verbal and Written skills and background information to be provided several times to several different people.
Interview Questions: Why you want to work for Piedmont.

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I was contacted by the recruiter 48 hours after submitting my application. She asked several basic questions about my experience, availability, what I was looking for in a position, etc. After a 10-15 minute conversation we scheduled an interview for the following week. 
The in-person interview was scheduled for me to sit down with the head of the department that I had applied for. She asked a few clinical questions "what who you do if patient X was experiencing this" kind of questions, as well as basic interview questions. 
I received a call the following day with a job offer and a start date.
Interview Questions: Why Piedmont?

title: New Graduate Nursing Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: A panel interview primarily focusing on clinical scenarios. They asked a few questions about experiences I've had, but very few of the traditional "where do you see yourself in five years/strengths/weaknesses" questions I've had in other interviews. They present you 2 scenarios that you have to come up with an initial diagnosis and nursing interventions for.
Interview Questions: Tell us about how your attention to detail made a difference in delivering patient care.

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: I showed up. They asked me a few questions. We went on a tour of the facility. I had the opportunity to ask more questions. They called me back with an offer the next day.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you went the extra mile.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview, hiring manager was very nice. I got a call for the interview about 3 weeks after I put in my application. They really need nurses. Many of my friends from nursing school also got jobs here
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: New Grad RN Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (New York, NY) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with the director of emergency services and manager of emergency department.  Both were nice and seemed to be super busy. The director mainly wants you to ask questions and seems to be impressed when you can answer with confidence.
Interview Questions: Why piedmont?

title: Pct/Unit Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Stockbridge, GA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: The process was engaging. The manager and the team really want to get to know you. they want to make sure you are a great fit for the unit.  Promoting excellent patient care is a goal they want to make sure you are on board with. Ensuring you will be careful to implement safety is key. They want to make sure you are ready to take care of the patients above and beyond measures. Which is so important!
Interview Questions: Tell me how would you handle a difficult patients family member?

title: Nurse Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare
Interview Descriptions: I completed my application online and was contacted several days later by a recruiter. They completed an over the phone interview with me, asking about 5 basic questions. I didn't receive a lot of feedback right away, I could tell she was just writing down all of my answers. I then received another call about a week later to schedule an interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a nurse?

title: Clinical Care Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare
Interview Descriptions: The Nurse that I interviewed with was positive and welcoming. They asked me basic interview questions and showed me around the floor I would be working on.I believe that if given the position it will be a welcoming and accommodating place to work.
Interview Questions: What would you say is one of your strengths?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Met with nurse manager and got a walk through tour of the unit. Answered situational type questions and explained my goals and why I wanted to be at this hospital as opposed to others.
Interview Questions: How many times have you been late? How many times have you called out?

title: Patient Escort Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Newnan, GA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly management and staff.  You are definitely made to feel welcome in most areas. Clear expectations of job and what it entailed.  Also was flexible with shift availability.
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with 6 different managers for the nurse residency program-acute care. They asked lots of situational questions and there were 2 scenarios that I had to determine what I would do.
Interview Questions: Tell us a time you experienced conflict at work?

title: Third Part Accounts Receivable Medicare Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with Agency then a face to face interview with Manager. I was offered the position the same day temp to perm after 90 days. Dress code was business casual. Drug Screen and Background check cleared fast, onboarding process was fast.
Interview Questions: Where did I see myself in 5 years.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Stockbridge, GA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with three managers, they were really nice and professional. Asked typical behavioral and situational questions. Asked when I would hear back from them and the recruiter told me in a week but I heard back from them the next day.
Interview Questions: What did you do when you witnessed someone doing something unethical?

title: Physician Recruitment Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: The process was pretty quick. I interviewed with the team, the manager, and director. I was offered the position that same day. The interviews were back to back. I never talked to a recruiter. The manager handled the entire process from start to finish.
Interview Questions: This role requires extensive attention to detail. What steps would you take to ensure that your work was high quality?

title: New Grad RN Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and met with HR recruiter at school career fair. I then heard back in about like 2-3 weeks later from HR about interview scheduling. HR set up a panel style interview with about 5 managers of different med-surg. Not all the managers were there that day.
Interview Questions: Why Piedmont? Why med-surg? Time you made a mistake? 2 scenario questions

title: Nurse Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Heard back from a recruiter within a few days of applying online. The interview was very relaxed and friendly and only took about 30 minutes. Heard back with an offer a week later.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you had a busy day on a floor and how you handled it.

title: HIM ASSOCIATE I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Stockbridge, GA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was smooth. You just have to be prepared for the question and give a great answer. Make sure you do a background study on hospital mission and values.
Interview Questions: How do you work under pressure/ stress and how are you able to handle it?

title: Evs Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Fayetteville, GA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Received a call on 1/19/16, interviewed on 1/22, offered and accepted on 2/3/16. The recruiter was very nice and the interviewer was very personable and professional. She did not make me feel nervous. Took about a week to get back to me. Went for the occupational health screening and I was given my orientation date and uniform requirements, along with the benefits information.
Interview Questions: What is customer service to me?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Got a call from recruiting office the next day applied for the position. Scheduled interview date for next week. The interviewer was very easy to talk to, not intimidating at all.
Interview Questions: Basic Interview questions like "tell me about yourself?, tell me when you take care of difficult pt?, tell me when you had a Conflict with another RN?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly easy to navigate.  I was called in for 4 interview which is considered a lot because they were all on campus and with several different people.  Some of the questions during my interviews were irrelevant and unprofessional.
Interview Questions: What are  your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Advanced Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Professional but personable, explained the position, asked what I was looking for in the position, showed me around the office, asked what I would be most interested in. Interview was very caring and geared towards making sure it was a great fit for me as well.
Interview Questions: Why I wanted to go into this field, What I liked most about this field, My best and worst qualities

title: RN Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare
Interview Descriptions: I turned in my application online and HR called me to set up an interview time. I came early and I was interviewed right away. Interview questions were standard and the atmosphere was comfortable. I had one person and after speaking with them I got a tour of the unit.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Registered Nursing Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Because I knew the department personnel, the interview was very laid back and contained the typical interview questions. Only about 5 questions. The interview lasted a little over 30 minutes. Will not know the results or if an offer is made til the next week.
Interview Questions: What do you consider your strengths,How would you deal with your  weaknesses, where do you see yourself in 5 years, how do you deal with a conflict with a colleague. Why do you want to work at Piedmont and why in this particular department.

title: Primary Care NP Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very formal. After applying it took some time to hear back but the process was structured and formal. I met with the recruiter and the hiring manager. They asked a series of structured questions and then allowed me to ask my own questions.
Interview Questions: They asked clinical based questions and scenarios. They also asked about conflict management skills

title: New Grad RN Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online to 3 different Residency programs on the same day. All of them were on different floors at Piedmont. I got a call from HR the next morning. She was very friendly and she asked me a few questions about my resume, clinical experience and what floor I'm interested in. I was then scheduled an interview for the following week. 
The same person from HR greeted me when I arrive for my interview and introduced me to 2 nurse managers. They were very nice and not at all intimitating. They asked me about 5-7 behavioral questions then They gave me  2 clinical scenarios. One was about infection and the other about a stoke pt. On those 2 questions you have to walk them through the nursing care and what the doctor might order. I thought I messed up on the first question and had no chance of getting the job but they called me the next day with a job offer. Just be as  friendly and honest as you can! Overall it lasted about 20 minutes and it was a good experience!
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at this hospital?

title: Senior Strategic Sourcing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare
Interview Descriptions:
Had an initial phone interview with the hiring manager.
Then an In-person/All-day interview with VP of Supply Chain, 2 Exec Directors and Sourcing Team.
Interviews were 1 hour each consisting of Candid Conversation.
Typical interview questions.
No STAR format required, but behavioral questions were asked.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Revenue Cycle Coding and Analytics Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was initially cold called by a recruiter from Piedmont Healthcare. I was then screened by a recruiter who set me up to complete a 1:1 interview with the Director. After the 1:1 with the Director, I was scheduled for a panel  interview with the entire Revenue Cycle Physician Billing team - Coding Manager, Coding Director, Collection/Insurance Follow-Up Managers (3), Revenue Cycle Director, and the Executive Director for Physician Revenue Cycle.
Interview Questions: The Directors and Executive Directors will meet with you first. A few questions and then collectively they will ambush you at once and ask you how much money you make and how much you want to do the job. I was unprepared for this as it has been my experience that this is a conversation between the candidate and HR, especially for all of them to want this personal information with respect to current salary. So be prepared that they will ask. They will do this before the other Managers join the interview.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions:
Met with HR and Manager. Interviewed with Manager and toured unit.
Completed a Math test for RNs, drug screen and background check. Manager was willing to offer job pending HR requirements such as testing, background check, etc.
Was offered job.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Received a call and email from HR with details of interview. Met with 1 individual who was the hiring "manager" ; no panel was provided to ensure objectivity and a fair assessment. Interviewer directly stated she decided to forgo asking any of the traditional scenario based questions and instead directed the conversation as to what I have been doing since my departure from Piedmont (I am a former employee). Overall, interview lasted about an hour and seemed mostly social ( ex: Do you remember so and so?) which was a huge red flag to me and left me with the ideation that the interview was held just to meet an HR requirement/benchmark that they consider and interview  former Piedmont employees. Although it was nice to "catch-up", I sincerely went into the interview with the mindset that I would have an amazing opportunity to professionally represent myself and have a panel interview with other hiring unit managers/supervisors. I was very disappointed in this experience and feel completely duped.
Interview Questions: What shift do you prefer to work?

title: Collections Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was held one on one. I was able to learn a lot about the company. This organization is Diverst and and well grounded. The benefits are wonderful and staff is great
Interview Questions: What qualities do I possess to benefit the company

title: Clinical Resource Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Jasper, GA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: First interview was with supervisors from different departments.  I was called the following day to schedule a second interview.  Second interview was with peers within that department.  After the second interview I was asked what my wage requirements were.
Interview Questions: Where do I see myself after I graduate from college.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview, long process filling out paper work. TB test. Back ground check, drug test. A lot of Human Resource work to get started. had to fill out two different applications on line.
Interview Questions: Asked basic background questions about ability and work

title: New Grad Nurse Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare
Interview Descriptions: First I was emailed asking if I'd like a phone interview about 2 weeks after I applied. Then had a brief phone interview about 15 minutes and was scheduled for a panel interview at the end of the conversation. Panel interview was 2 managers and very polite. Interview consisted of basic questions they write your answers as you go. Then followed by 2 scenario based questions. Total interview was about 30 minutes. Told I would be contacted within a week with a decision.
Interview Questions: Describe a time in your clinical experience when you witnessed something unsafe and what you did in response.

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: I was hesitant to apply based on the reviews. The interview was the worst I have had in all my life. I was screened by an HR call for about 15 minutes and then set up for an interview for 2 weeks later. In person interview was with three people and they were late. Started off with introductions and I went into talking about my experience and 15 mins in the Manager said they were looking for someone with more experience and that I should have the stuff I talked about on my resume. I had to point out that it was on my resume. It was clear they hadn't read my resume and if they wanted someone with "more experience" they should not have requested an interview. A month later recruiter called to let me know that I didn't get the job, big surprise.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Manager Revenue Cycle Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Extremely long.  Interviewed with a total of 7 people.  Was scheduled from 10-12 and didn't leave until after 2 pm.  Met with several executive directors.  They did most of the talking about where the company was and trying to grow to.
Interview Questions: Why Piedmont?

title: HIM/HSIA Student Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Stockbridge, GA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The manager was contacted to let him him know the exact day that i was going to start my internship. The date and time was set up, and that is when I had my interview without knowing that I was going to have one. Everything went well though. The questions were easy to answer.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little bit about yourself.

title: New Nurse Residency Program-medsurg Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare
Interview Descriptions: Got a call from a HR recruiter asking to schedule an interview about 4 weeks after applying. Scheduled two weeks out, she was very nice and gave me information about what to expect. Arrived 30 minutes early and was greeted by the HR lady that called me and was offered water and told me they were on time and would be with me soon. It was a panel interview with 6 clinical managers from the different medsurg floors and an educator of some sort. So 7 people total. They each introduced themselves and described their floors. They had about ten questions they each took turns asking and each wrote notes about my answers. After the questions were done there was 2 clinical scenario questions that they wanted you to read and talk through what you would do in each scenario. Pretty simple scenarios about clients post surgery with suspected infection and one with s/s of a stroke. Just asked what would you want to get ordered and what would you do. After that they asked what areas you were most interested in. They each gave me their business card when I left. It was very quick 15-20 minutes top and was very laid back and comfortable. I was called before I got home and was offered 3 different positions.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you used attention to detail to make a decision.

title: Contract Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview then on site interview. This was a panel interview with the people I would work with and then an 1 on 1 with my supervisor. They then asked back for a third interview where I met the executives on a panel and VP 1 on 1. The whole process took about three months. And after the last interview I never heard back from them. Since I made it so far in the process I thought it was extemely unprofessional for them not to even call and let me know the status. In short I was really disappointed.
Interview Questions: Standard interview questions

title: Senior Imaging Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: They first did a lengthy phone interview with many behavioral interview questions in order to limit the candidates for a personal interview.  The personal interview involved the whole team who each asked another round of behavioral or situational questions.
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult situation with a co-worker and how did you handle it?

title: Healthcare Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I received a phone call from the recruiting manager within minutes of applying to the position. The interview seemed positive. The recruiting manager lead me to believe that I would receive a call with positive news within 24 hours. After no call or email within 24 hours, I left voicemails and emails and received no reply. I would have appreciated any follow up, positive or negative.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to leave your current position/company?

title: Healthcare Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare
Interview Descriptions: Took quite a while to go through the screening process, although the interview was easy.  From interview to written offer took several weeks.  They do group orientation so you have 2 days per month that you can select to start working.
Interview Questions: No unexpected questions

title: Applications Training Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare
Interview Descriptions: Reached out from LinkedIn about a position with their Epic Training staff, went through an initial interview with a person from HR regarding the company and some about the position and the payscale for it.  After that interview the manager of the team I was going to be working for did my second interview which was more content based, ensuring that I was up to speed and knew what I was talking about.  After that salary negotiatons began with HR
Interview Questions: What about your prior experience makes you the best candidate for this position.

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions:
First contacted through LinkedIn by a recruiter. One phone interview with the recruiter and then was asked to schedule an onsite interview. 

Met with current receptionist, two staff assistants and HR. Interview lasted a little over an hour. Started with formal (generic) questions, which then lead to more of a conversational style interview process. Overall it was a great, 'laid-back' process.
Interview Questions: Typical Interview questions. Was asked if I had kids (big no-no during an interview).

title: Applications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare
Interview Descriptions: Submitted Resume, interviewed by two managers, and then interviewed by the team.  Questions that were asked were sometimes questionable interview questions.  Being an internal candidate didn't help based on interviewers.  Was asked why I don't eat lunch with certain people, among other things that were related to things outside of the actual job.
Interview Questions: Some interview questions were predictable, but some were inappropriate.

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Newnan, GA) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by an offsite Human Resources person who asked basic employment questions.  The telephone Interview was followed up with an interview with Manager of Department.  After interviewing and receiving offer was hired to start 2 weeks later.
Interview Questions: Availability and able to work changing hours.

title: Interventional Radiology Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was professional and friendly. I showed up for my interview and was seen on time. The manager and supervisor I met first, they where friendly and respectful.  We had the interview which was short and informative. Then they showed me the department and I met some of my future coworkers.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience as an Interventional Radiology Technologist?

title: Senior RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare
Interview Descriptions: -called by recruiter, set up interview with manager, was asked case scenario questions. Wasn't too bad
Interview Questions: -clinical questions (definitely had to think on your feet)

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions:
case studies for new grads, at least 3 and what would you do in each scenario. 
typical nursing questions- weakness, strength
panel interview with the main med surg floors usually 
drug calculations test 
bring copies of resume
Interview Questions:
3 qualities about yourself
why we should hire you
case studies- blood clot, stroke, pulmonary embolism

title: Pbx Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was a few brief questions then a handshake. Simple. It was very quick, in and out the door, and I felt no pressure or stress from it. This was one of the easier interviews I've had in a very long time. It was pleasant.
Interview Questions: When I could work, basic things.

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (North Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: The actual interview process was fine.  Getting there was difficult because of the numerous mistakes made by the person trying to set it up....wrong name on email, different date reserved (upon confirmation), etc.  The first and second interviews were quite smooth. I believe both managers were simply eager to have somebody in place to help.
Interview Questions: The worst question was simply the old, "What was a situation/incident in your last job that was a problem and how did you address it?"

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Fayetteville, GA) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was with the manager of the floor I was applying to and a manager from another Med-surg floor. I think the interview lasted between 30 min to 1 hour. It was relaxed but professional. They understood I was a new graduate from nursing school and were patient with me and my answers. They were positive and friendly.
Interview Questions: What is one of your nursing skills you feel most confident in?

title: Reception Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Statesville, NC) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Go to corporate and interview with administration and if they like you they will send you to whatever office they need you at and you interview with the office manager there
Interview Questions: What makes you qualified for this job

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with recruiter on skills and interest in position.  Next, 1:1 interview with recruiter about the position and culture of organization. Lastly, 1:1 interview with hiring manager. More conversational discussing past work experiences and duties of position. Interview was not difficult and I was able to ask questions about expectations and future goals for the department. Did background check before official offer. Drug screen after offer.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Accounting Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Nov 2009
Interview Descriptions: Very chaotic.  They were obviously short staffed.  Managers were scrambling throughout the building.   They seem highly stressed and ineffective.  Second interview was scheduled 3 months after the first.  Third interview scheduled 1 month later, with not communication in between any of the interviews.
Interview Questions: None were difficult, it was just obvious that they needed help with difficult staff

title: Director of Philanthropy Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Piedmont Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2009
Interview Descriptions: Was introduced to leader at Piedmont who was planning to expand staff.  Submitted resume and cover letter, received phone interview, interviewed with HR, was asked to meet with another person in the department, another interview with leader, interview with a hospital CEO, received offer in a call from HR.  I was notified up front that the process would be lengthy and slow, which it was.  However, I felt that I was appropriately notified along the way.  Overall a very positive experience.
Interview Questions: I was asked about experience closing specific gifts.
